code: library(deltaR) library(dplyr)  # Configure S3 storage s3_options <- list(   aws_access_key_id = Sys.getenv("AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID"),   aws_secret_access_key = Sys.getenv("AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY"),   aws_region = "us-east-1" )  # Read source data # Read from S3 using arrow source_dt <- delta_table(   "s3://data-lake/bronze/raw_events",   storage_options = s3_options )  # Get file paths and read with arrow, then transform files <- get_files(source_dt) transformed_data <- arrow::open_dataset(files) |>   filter(event_type == "purchase") |>   mutate(     event_date = as.Date(event_timestamp),     revenue = quantity * unit_price   ) |>   select(event_id, user_id, event_date, product_id, revenue) |>   collect()  # Write to silver layer write_deltalake(   transformed_data,   "s3://data-lake/silver/purchases",   mode = "append",   partition_by = "event_date",   storage_options = s3_options )

title: Using deltaR with Cloud Storage
code: library(deltaR)  # Configure GCS storage gcs_options <- list(   google_service_account_path = Sys.getenv("GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS") )  # Create a new Delta table sales_data <- data.frame(   sale_id = 1:1000,   store_id = sample(1:50, 1000, replace = TRUE),   product_id = sample(1:200, 1000, replace = TRUE),   sale_date = as.Date("2024-01-01") + sample(0:364, 1000, replace = TRUE),   quantity = sample(1:20, 1000, replace = TRUE),   total_amount = round(runif(1000, 10, 1000), 2) )  write_deltalake(   sales_data,   "gs://analytics-lakehouse/sales/daily",   partition_by = "sale_date",   name = "daily_sales",   description = "Daily sales transactions from all stores",   storage_options = gcs_options )  # Later: append new data new_sales <- data.frame(   sale_id = 1001:1100,   store_id = sample(1:50, 100, replace = TRUE),   product_id = sample(1:200, 100, replace = TRUE),   sale_date = as.Date("2025-01-01") + sample(0:30, 100, replace = TRUE),   quantity = sample(1:20, 100, replace = TRUE),   total_amount = round(runif(100, 10, 1000), 2) )  write_deltalake(   new_sales,   "gs://analytics-lakehouse/sales/daily",   mode = "append",   storage_options = gcs_options )

code: library(deltaR)  # Source: AWS S3 s3_options <- list(   aws_access_key_id = Sys.getenv("AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID"),   aws_secret_access_key = Sys.getenv("AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY"),   aws_region = "us-east-1" )  # Destination: Azure Blob Storage azure_options <- list(   azure_storage_account_name = Sys.getenv("AZURE_STORAGE_ACCOUNT"),   azure_storage_account_key = Sys.getenv("AZURE_STORAGE_KEY") )  # Read from S3 using arrow source_dt <- delta_table(   "s3://source-bucket/important_data",   storage_options = s3_options ) files <- get_files(source_dt) data <- arrow::open_dataset(files) |> dplyr::collect()  # Write to Azure write_deltalake(   data,   "az://backup-container/important_data",   mode = "overwrite",   storage_options = azure_options )

title: Getting Started with deltaR
text: deltaR provides R interface Delta Lake, open-source storage layer brings ACID transactions data lakes. Built high-performance delta-rs Rust library, deltaR enables read write Delta tables directly R minimal overhead.

title: Getting Started with deltaR
text: Delta Lake open-source storage framework enables building lakehouse architecture. Key features include: ACID Transactions: Ensures data integrity even concurrent reads writes Time Travel: Access restore previous versions data Schema Enforcement: Prevents bad data written Schema Evolution: Allows schema changes time Scalable Metadata: Handles petabyte-scale tables billions files

title: Getting Started with deltaR
code: # Create sample data sales_data <- data.frame(   order_id = 1:100,   customer_id = sample(1:20, 100, replace = TRUE),   product = sample(c("Widget", "Gadget", "Gizmo"), 100, replace = TRUE),   quantity = sample(1:10, 100, replace = TRUE),   price = round(runif(100, 10, 500), 2),   order_date = as.Date("2024-01-01") + sample(0:364, 100, replace = TRUE) )  # Write to a Delta table write_deltalake(sales_data, "path/to/sales_table")

title: Getting Started with deltaR
text: deltaR supports four write modes:
code: # error (default): Fail if the table already exists write_deltalake(sales_data, "path/to/table", mode = "error")  # append: Add new data to an existing table new_sales <- data.frame(   order_id = 101:110,   customer_id = sample(1:20, 10, replace = TRUE),   product = sample(c("Widget", "Gadget", "Gizmo"), 10, replace = TRUE),   quantity = sample(1:10, 10, replace = TRUE),   price = round(runif(10, 10, 500), 2),   order_date = as.Date("2025-01-01") + sample(0:30, 10, replace = TRUE) ) write_deltalake(new_sales, "path/to/sales_table", mode = "append")  # overwrite: Replace all data in the table write_deltalake(sales_data, "path/to/sales_table", mode = "overwrite")  # ignore: Do nothing if the table already exists write_deltalake(sales_data, "path/to/table", mode = "ignore")

title: Getting Started with deltaR
text: Partitioning improves query performance organizing data directories based column values: query partitioned table filters partition columns, Delta Lake can skip reading irrelevant partitions entirely.
code: # Partition by date and product write_deltalake(   sales_data,   "path/to/partitioned_sales",   partition_by = c("order_date", "product") )

title: Getting Started with deltaR
text: deltaR delegates reading libraries like arrow, polars, duckdb. Use get_files() get list Parquet files pass preferred library:
code: # Get the list of Parquet files in the Delta table files <- get_files(dt)  # Read with arrow library(arrow) arrow_table <- open_dataset(files)  # Read as a data.frame (for small data) df <- arrow_table |> collect()  # Read with dplyr for filtering library(dplyr)  high_value_orders <- open_dataset(files) |>   filter(price > 200) |>   select(order_id, customer_id, price) |>   collect()  # Alternative: Read with duckdb library(duckdb) con <- dbConnect(duckdb()) duckdb_register_arrow(con, "sales", arrow_table) result <- dbGetQuery(con, "SELECT * FROM sales WHERE price > 200") dbDisconnect(con)

title: Getting Started with deltaR
text: time, Delta tables accumulate old files previous versions. vacuum() function removes files longer needed: Warning: Vacuuming removes ability time travel versions older retention period. Choose retention period carefully based needs.
code: dt <- delta_table("path/to/sales_table")  # Dry run - see what would be deleted files_to_delete <- vacuum(dt, retention_hours = 168, dry_run = TRUE) print(files_to_delete)  # Actually delete old files (default retention is 7 days = 168 hours) vacuum(dt, retention_hours = 168, dry_run = FALSE)

title: Write data to a Delta Lake table ‚Äî write_deltalake
text: data Data write. Can data.frame, Arrow Table, Arrow RecordBatch, object can converted Arrow RecordBatchReader via nanoarrow::as_nanoarrow_array_stream(). table_or_uri Character. Path Delta table (local filesystem cloud storage URI). mode Character. handle existing data. One : "error" (default): Fail table exists. "append": Add new data table. "overwrite": Replace data table. "ignore": nothing table exists. partition_by Character vector. Column names partition (optional). name Character. Table name metadata (optional, used creating new table). description Character. Table description metadata (optional). storage_options Named list. Storage backend options credentials (optional). schema_mode Character. handle schema evolution (optional). One : "overwrite": Replace schema new schema. "merge": Merge new schema existing schema. target_file_size Integer. Target size bytes output file (optional). set, writer try create files approximately size.

title: deltaR 0.1.0
text: Initial release deltaR, R interface Delta Lake. Reading Delta tables: Open query Delta tables delta_table(). Writing Delta tables: Create modify Delta tables write_deltalake(). Time travel: Access historical versions load_version() load_datetime(). Schema evolution: Support schema_mode = "merge" schema_mode = "overwrite". Partitioned tables: Create partitioned tables partition_by parameter. Cloud storage support: Native support Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage. Table maintenance: vacuum() method remove old files. Table creation: create_deltalake() create empty tables predefined schema.
